medical_history.chief_complaint: Intermittent pain and a pins-and-needles sensation in the legs.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Paresthesias developed in the patient's toes one month prior to presentation, spreading gradually to his shins. Symptoms progressed over a 1-month period. There was no lower back pain, muscle weakness, fever, or other systemic symptoms.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection, hypertension, history of intravenous heroin use for 33 years, and 52 pack-years smoking history.
medical_history.social_history: Homeless, current intravenous drug user, reported rare alcohol intake, not sexually active.
